title.narrative: WOA: Building peace from common values in isolated communities
WOA: Fredsbyggande utifrån gemensamma värderingar i isolerade samhällen

description.narrative: Overall objective: This contribution aims at contributing to enhanced peace, improved livelihoods and strengthening local community resilience in hard-to-reach areas affected by recurrent conflicts. Specific objectives include: (1) The socio-economic conditions of beneficiaries (ex-combatants, young people at risk, women, refugees and displaced persons & host communities) are improved (2) Rural women and youth's influence and participation in all stages of the stabilization and peacebuilding process, as they are recognized as actors of socio-economic change (3) Women leaders, members of "pools of excellence" are involved in building peace, participatory and inclusive governance of local entities and community development (4) Basic community infrastructures used by all and which promote social cohesion are built or rehabilitated (e.g. schools, youth centers, health centers and hospitals, youth training centers). At the end of the project, inter- and intra-community social cohesion will be strengthened, livelihoods improved and the risk for disadvantaged young people joining armed groups substantially reduced.

Denna insats fokuserar på fredsbyggande aktiviteter i svåråtkomliga områden som drabbats av permanent instabilitet i Syd - och NordKivu. Insatsen syftar till att skapa lokala mekanismer och initiativ för långvarig fred genom att skapa och förstärka ekonomiska möjligheter för utsatta grupper, inklusive för kvinnor och ungdomar, samt bygga upp och återuppliva viktiga lokala sociala strukturer som förenar medborgarna. En viktig del av denna insats är att eliminera förhållanden som annars motiverar ungdomar att ingå i väpnade grupper. Att återbygga skolor och uppmuntra barn och ungdomar till att utbilda sig blir i detta sammanhang ett sätt att erbjuda alternativ till rekrytering i väpnade grupper. Således kommer samhällens deltagande i rehabilitering av skolor att främjas i de drabbade områdena. Andra utvalda viktiga samhällsinfrastrukturer kommer identifieras och stödjas (eg. en till tre små vattenkraftverk) där det är möjligt. Utrymmen avsedda för ungdomar och som försetts med bibliotek kommer att lanseras. Detta ger möjligheter till utbildning och diskussioner om fred och samhällsutveckling samt till entreprenörskap. Lokala aktörer inom det civila samhället kommer att uppmuntras att ansluta sig till fredliga initiativ på provins- och nationell nivå för långvarig fred och social sammanhållning.

This contribution focuses on peacebuilding and resilience enhancing activities in hard-to-reach areas affected by permanent instability in South and North Kivu. The contribution is aimed at creating local spaces, mechanisms and initiatives for long-lasting peace by strengthening economic empowerment of vulnerable groups through enhancing their means of subsistence including for women and youth, as well as strengthening the capacities of local state structures and other local leaders. One critical component of this contribution is to eliminate conditions that motivate youngsters to join or remain in armed groups, for instance by encouraging education of children as a way of providing alternatives to recruitment into armed groups. Thus, communities participation in rehabilitation of schools will be promoted in the affected areas. Other selected critical community infrastructures will be supported (one to three small hydroelectrical power plants) might be supported where feasible. Youth peaceful spaces, with librairies (books brought from France) will be initiated and encouraged, providing spaces where training and discussions on peaceful cohabitation as well as various vocational training and entrepreneurship will take place. Local civil society stakeholders will be encouraged to link up with provincial and national levels to strengthen peace and social cohesion through the opening up of their otherwise isolated areas.

description.narrative: The project started for about four months ago. The realisations are so far limited to a number of organisational arrangements/improvements that were required as per the agreement conditions, including: - The operational plan for year 1 has been developed, the acquisition of equipments completed, the installation of project sites in the target territories completed as well as the deployment of field staff. - Installation of a new management software to facilitate and streamline financial management, stock and human resources etc. This has now been completed. - Recruitment of the program staff: the process is now completed at 75%, as there are a few positions still under process of being filled. Key program staff are in place, except that the head of programmes initially selected has been removed after probationary period (3 months), and a new recruitment round has been launched. - A visible focus of the organisational change has been put on the finance function as recommended by Ernst & Young: a new accountant and an internal auditor have been recruited and the old financial manager removed.
